tutorialSidebar.label: Why Robotics? A Deep Dive into the Motivation and Impact

active_perception.title: Active Perception in Robotics
active_perception.description: This document defines active perception, contrasts it with traditional passive perception, highlights its advantages in various robotics applications, and provides concrete examples of its implementation.

ai-ml.title: AI and Machine Learning for Humanoids
ai-ml.description: The "brain" of a modern humanoid is shifting from hard-coded control theory to data-driven AI.

applications.title: Applications and Use Cases
applications.description: Why do we need humanoids? Why not just use wheels?

aws_robomaker.title: AWS RoboMaker: Cloud-Based Robotics Development and Deployment
aws_robomaker.description: This document provides an overview of AWS RoboMaker, Amazon's cloud-based service for robotics developers. RoboMaker extends ROS and ROS 2 with cloud services, enabling large-scale simulation, intelligent robotics functions, and automated deployment.

components.title: Key Components of Humanoid Robots
components.description: Building a humanoid is a systems engineering challenge. It requires tight coupling between hardware and software.

ethics.title: Ethical Considerations and Future Challenges
ethics.description: As humanoids transition from YouTube demos to real-world deployment, we face serious questions.

history.title: History of Humanoid Robotics
history.description: The quest to create artificial life is as old as engineering itself. The modern history of humanoid robotics is a journey from stiff, pre-programmed machines to dynamic, learning-based agents.

intro.title: Introduction to Humanoid Robotics
intro.description: Welcome to the Humanoid Robotics and Physical AI course. This comprehensive guide covers everything from the fundamentals of Physical AI to advanced humanoid systems, computer vision, and the latest SOTA (State of the Art) developments in the field.

introduction.title: Introduction to Physical AI
introduction.description: Physical AI refers to artificial intelligence that interacts with the physical world. Unlike purely digital AI (like language models or recommendation algorithms), Physical AI involves systems that can perceive, reason about, and act upon their environment. This requires a deep integration of hardware (sensors, actuators) and software (perception, control, and learning algorithms). Humanoid robotics is one of the most prominent and challenging subfields of Physical AI.

sota.title: Current State-of-the-Art (SOTA)
sota.description: The landscape of humanoid robotics is exploding. Here are the key players defining the field in the mid-2020s.

vision_language_models.title: Vision-Language Models (VLMs): Bridging the Digital Brain with the Physical World
vision_language_models.description: This document explores Vision-Language Models (VLMs), a class of AI that combines the power of large language models with visual understanding. We will delve into their evolution, architecture, key capabilities, and provide a comparison of prominent models.

week-01-02-physical-ai/assessment.title: Week 1-2 Assessment: Physical AI and Humanoid Fundamentals
week-01-02-physical-ai/assessment.description: This document covers the fundamental concepts of physical AI, with a focus on humanoid robotics, their justification, key technologies, and the ethical implications.

week-03-05-ros2/urdf-robot-description.title: Weeks 3-5: ROS 2 Fundamentals - Creating a URDF Robot Description
week-03-05-ros2/urdf-robot-description.description: This document provides a comprehensive, in-depth guide to creating a Unified Robot Description Format (URDF) file from scratch. URDF is an essential XML format used in ROS 2 to describe all elements of a robot model. By the end of this tutorial, you will have a complete URDF for a simple wheeled robot and a deep understanding of each component.

week-08-10-isaac/sim-to-real.title: Weeks 8-10: Advanced Simulation with Isaac Sim & the Sim-to-Real Challenge
week-08-10-isaac/sim-to-real.description: This document introduces NVIDIA's Isaac Sim and explores the critical robotics concept of "Sim-to-Real." We'll discuss why it's a major challenge and the strategies used to overcome it, particularly with advanced simulators like Isaac Sim.

week-11-12-humanoid/project.title: Weeks 11-12: Capstone Project - Humanoid Butler Bot
week-11-12-humanoid/project.description: This document outlines the capstone project for the humanoid development course. The goal is to integrate all the concepts learned in the previous weeks—from robot description and control to simulation and AI—to build a simulated "Butler Bot." This robot will be capable of navigating a home environment, perceiving objects, and performing a simple fetch-and-carry task.

week-13-conversational/multimodal-interf.title: Week 13: Conversational AI - Multimodal Interfaces for Human-Robot Interaction
week-13-conversational/multimodal-interf.description: This document explores the concept of multimodal interfaces in the context of human-robot interaction, combining speech with other modalities like vision, gestures, and haptics to create more natural and intuitive communication channels.

week-13-conversational/whisper-speech-to.title: Week 13: Conversational AI - Speech-to-Text with Whisper
week-13-conversational/whisper-speech-to.description: This guide explains how to integrate a powerful speech-to-text (STT) model, OpenAI's Whisper, into a ROS 2 application. This will allow our robot to understand voice commands from a user.

why_robotics.title: Why Robotics? A Deep Dive into the Motivation and Impact
why_robotics.description: This document explores the fundamental reasons driving the relentless pursuit of advancements in robotics. From societal benefits to economic transformation and scientific exploration, robotics stands as a pivotal field shaping the future.
